name: vincible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be defeated or successfully controlled or dealt with: He claims that most ignorance is vincible ignorance - we do not know because we choose not to know. The team has looked distinctly vincible recently, although they pushed their opponents hard.
More examplesFewer examplesWe are talking about vincible ignorance, when the sinner does not know certain actions to be sins.The trouble with invincibility is that it disappears with a single defeat and may never return - this team has now become distinctly vincible.
